title: Chicxulub Impact Event
summary: A massive asteroid struck Earth causing the mass extinction that wiped out the dinosaurs and many other species.

title: First Stone Tools
summary: Early humans created stone tools marking the beginning of technology.

title: Control of Fire
summary: Humans learned to control fire for cooking and warmth.

title: Emergence of Homo sapiens
summary: Modern humans evolved in Africa.

title: Neolithic Revolution
summary: Humans began agriculture and settled societies.

title: First Known Cities
summary: The first urban settlements emerged in Mesopotamia.

title: Invention of Writing
summary: The Sumerians developed cuneiform writing.

title: Construction of the Pyramids of Giza
summary: The Great Pyramid was built in Egypt.

title: Code of Hammurabi
summary: One of the earliest written legal codes was established.

title: Fall of the Indus Valley Civilization
summary: Decline of major urban centers in South Asia.

title: Trojan War (Traditional Date)
summary: Legendary conflict between Greeks and Trojans.

title: Founding of Rome
summary: Traditional founding date of Rome.

title: First Olympic Games
summary: Ancient Greece held the first recorded Olympic Games.

title: Birth of Confucius
summary: Chinese philosopher Confucius was born.

title: Birth of Buddha
summary: Siddhartha Gautama was born and later founded Buddhism.

title: Construction of the Great Wall Begins
summary: Early fortifications in China were built.

title: Persian Empire Founded
summary: Cyrus the Great established the Achaemenid Empire.

title: Death of Socrates
summary: Greek philosopher Socrates was executed.

title: Construction of the Parthenon
summary: Athenian temple dedicated to Athena was completed.

title: Alexander the Great Becomes King
summary: Alexander began his conquests across Persia and beyond.

title: Death of Alexander the Great
summary: Alexander died at age 32.

title: Construction of the Colosseum Begins
summary: Rome started building the Colosseum.

title: Founding of the Roman Empire
summary: Augustus became the first Roman Emperor.

title: Birth of Jesus Christ
summary: Traditional date for the birth of Jesus.

title: Destruction of Pompeii
summary: Mount Vesuvius erupted burying Pompeii.

title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
summary: Deposition of the last Roman emperor in the West.

title: Founding of Constantinople
summary: Byzantium became the capital of the Roman Empire.

title: Rise of Islam
summary: Prophet Muhammad received the first revelations.

title: Hijra
summary: Muhammad migrated from Mecca to Medina.

title: Fall of the Sassanian Empire
summary: Islamic conquest ended Persian rule.

title: Battle of Tours
summary: Frankish forces halted Muslim expansion in Western Europe.

title: Viking Age Begins
summary: Norse explorers began raids and settlements.

title: Coronation of Charlemagne
summary: Charlemagne was crowned Holy Roman Emperor.

title: Founding of the Kingdom of England
summary: Athelstan became the first King of England.

title: First Universities in Europe
summary: Institutions of higher learning emerged.

title: First Crusade Begins
summary: European Christians launched a military campaign to the Holy Land.

title: Magna Carta Signed
summary: Limited the powers of the English monarchy.

title: Fall of Constantinople to Crusaders
summary: Fourth Crusade captured Constantinople.

title: Mongol Empire Founded
summary: Genghis Khan united Mongol tribes.

title: Black Death Begins
summary: A pandemic killed millions across Europe and Asia.

title: Battle of Agincourt
summary: English forces defeated the French.

title: Invention of the Printing Press
summary: Gutenberg invented movable type printing.

title: Fall of Constantinople to Ottomans
summary: The Byzantine Empire ended.

title: Discovery of the Americas
summary: Christopher Columbus reached the Caribbean.

title: Protestant Reformation Begins
summary: Martin Luther published the 95 Theses.

title: First Circumnavigation of the Earth
summary: Magellan’s expedition completed the first global voyage.

title: Scientific Revolution Begins
summary: Copernicus proposed heliocentrism.

title: Defeat of the Spanish Armada
summary: England defeated Spain’s naval invasion.

title: Founding of Jamestown
summary: First permanent English settlement in North America.

title: Galileo Supports Heliocentrism
summary: Galileo published observations supporting Copernicus.

title: English Civil War Begins
summary: Conflict between Parliamentarians and Royalists.

title: Treaty of Westphalia
summary: Ended the Thirty Years’ War and reshaped Europe.

title: Founding of the Royal Society
summary: Scientific institution was established in England.

title: Publication of Newton’s Principia
summary: Isaac Newton published laws of motion and gravity.

title: American Declaration of Independence
summary: Thirteen colonies declared independence from Britain.

title: French Revolution Begins
summary: Overthrow of monarchy in France.

title: Napoleon Becomes Emperor
summary: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned Emperor of France.

title: Abolition of the Slave Trade in Britain
summary: Britain outlawed the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Industrial Revolution Accelerates
summary: Steam engines and factories transformed economies.

title: First Photograph Taken
summary: Nicéphore Niépce captured the first permanent photograph.

title: American Civil War Begins
summary: Conflict between Union and Confederacy.

title: Emancipation Proclamation
summary: Abraham Lincoln declared slaves in Confederate states free.

title: Publication of On the Origin of Species
summary: Charles Darwin proposed the theory of evolution.

title: Telephone Invented
summary: Alexander Graham Bell patented the telephone.

title: Light Bulb Commercialized
summary: Thomas Edison developed practical electric lighting.

title: Automobile Invented
summary: Karl Benz built the first gasoline-powered car.

title: First Modern Olympic Games
summary: The Olympics were revived in Athens.

title: Discovery of X-rays
summary: Wilhelm Röntgen discovered X-rays.

title: First Powered Flight
summary: The Wright brothers achieved sustained flight.

title: Einstein Publishes Special Relativity
summary: Albert Einstein reshaped physics.

title: World War I Begins
summary: Global conflict involving major powers.

title: Russian Revolution
summary: Bolsheviks seized power in Russia.

title: End of World War I
summary: Armistice signed ending the war.

title: Treaty of Versailles
summary: Formal peace treaty ending WWI.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
summary: Alexander Fleming discovered antibiotics.

title: Stock Market Crash
summary: Triggered the Great Depression.

title: World War II Begins
summary: Germany invaded Poland.

title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
summary: Japan attacked U.S. naval base.

title: D-Day Landings
summary: Allied invasion of Normandy.

title: Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki
summary: Nuclear weapons were used for the first time in war.

title: United Nations Founded
summary: International organization formed to promote peace.

title: India Gains Independence
summary: India became independent from British rule.

title: Cold War Begins
summary: Geopolitical tension between the US and USSR.

title: Discovery of DNA Structure
summary: Watson and Crick identified DNA’s double helix.

title: First Artificial Satellite (Sputnik 1)
summary: Soviet Union launched the first satellite.

title: Cuban Missile Crisis
summary: Cold War standoff over nuclear missiles in Cuba.

title: First Human in Space
summary: Yuri Gagarin orbited Earth.

title: First Human on the Moon
summary: Apollo 11 landed on the Moon.

title: Internet (ARPANET) Goes Online
summary: First computer network communication.

title: Watergate Scandal Begins
summary: Political scandal leading to Nixon’s resignation.

title: Fall of Saigon
summary: Marked the end of the Vietnam War.

title: Personal Computer Revolution Begins
summary: Affordable home computers entered the market.

title: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
summary: Worst nuclear power plant accident.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
summary: Symbolized the end of the Cold War in Europe.

title: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
summary: The USSR officially collapsed.

title: World Wide Web Invented
summary: Tim Berners-Lee introduced the web.

title: Python Programming Language Released
summary: Guido van Rossum released Python 0.9.0.

title: Rwandan Genocide
summary: Mass killings in Rwanda.

title: First PlayStation Released
summary: Sony entered the gaming console market.

title: Google Founded
summary: Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded Google.

title: Y2K Millennium Bug Concern
summary: Global systems prepared for date rollover.

title: September 11 Attacks
summary: Terrorist attacks in the United States.

title: Launch of Wikipedia
summary: Free online encyclopedia was created.

title: Facebook Founded
summary: Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook.

title: YouTube Founded
summary: Video-sharing platform launched.

title: Global Financial Crisis Begins
summary: Collapse of major financial institutions.

title: First iPhone Released
summary: Apple launched the iPhone.

title: Arab Spring Begins
summary: Series of protests across the Middle East.

title: Discovery of Higgs Boson
summary: CERN confirmed existence of the Higgs particle.

title: Edward Snowden Revelations
summary: Leaks exposed global surveillance programs.

title: First Image of a Black Hole
summary: Astronomers released first black hole image.

title: COVID-19 Pandemic Declared
summary: WHO declared COVID-19 a global pandemic.

title: First mRNA Vaccines Deployed
summary: COVID-19 vaccines using mRNA were rolled out.

title: James Webb Space Telescope Launched
summary: NASA launched the most powerful space telescope.

title: ChatGPT Public Release
summary: OpenAI released ChatGPT to the public.

title: Russia Invades Ukraine
summary: Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: First Image from James Webb Space Telescope
summary: NASA released first deep-field image.

title: Breakthrough in Nuclear Fusion Ignition
summary: Scientists achieved net energy gain in fusion.

title: Artificial Intelligence Boom in Industry
summary: Generative AI adoption accelerated globally.

title: First Human Neuralink Implant
summary: Neuralink implanted a brain-computer interface.

title: Commercial Moon Landing by Private Company
summary: Private spacecraft successfully landed on the Moon.

title: Global Climate Records Broken
summary: Earth recorded the hottest average temperatures.
